The moment a tool makes an error, the instinctive reaction is: "It would‚Äôve been faster and safer if I‚Äôd just done it myself." After one bad experience, the tool is often not used again. Once bitten, twice shy.

With so many pitching some form of automation and/or "agentic AI" tool, I wouldn't be surprised if lawyers and law firms approach LegalTech firms with great suspicion. A deeper understanding of the customer‚Äôs context and of your own company‚Äôs technology, not just sales strategies, might go a long way in building trust and winning lawyers over as clients.
